segment.source: Application Dialog Box (Windows 10)
segment.target: Application Dialog Box (Windows 10)

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Application dialog box shows information about the selected application.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Application dialog box shows information about the selected application.

segment.source: Application Dialog Box
segment.target: Application Dialog Box

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Application dialog box shows information about the selected application.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Application dialog box shows information about the selected application.

segment.source: To open the Application dialog box
segment.target: To open the Application dialog box

segment.source: In ACM, in the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In ACM, in the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: Under an operating system heading, click Applications.
segment.target: Under an operating system heading, click Applications.

segment.source: Double-click the name of an application.
segment.target: Double-click the name of an application.

segment.source: Tabs in the Application dialog box
segment.target: Tabs in the Application dialog box

segment.source: The following table shows the information available in the Application dialog box.
segment.target: The following table shows the information available in the Application dialog box.

segment.source: Tab
segment.target: Tab

segment.source: Information
segment.target: Information

segment.source: Assessment
segment.target: Assessment

segment.source: Shows the compatibility ratings for the application from the application vendor, your internal organization, and the ACT Community.
segment.target: Shows the compatibility ratings for the application from the application vendor, your internal organization, and the ACT Community.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: For each issue associated with the selected application, shows:
segment.target: For each issue associated with the selected application, shows:

segment.source: The issue status, either active (a red X) or resolved (a green check mark).
segment.target: The issue status, either active (a red X) or resolved (a green check mark).

segment.source: The provider who created the record of the issue.
segment.target: The provider who created the record of the issue.

segment.source: The severity of the issue as entered by the provider.
segment.target: The severity of the issue as entered by the provider.

segment.source: The symptom of the issue as entered by the provider.
segment.target: The symptom of the issue as entered by the provider.

segment.source: The date on which the issue was added to the ACT database.
segment.target: The date on which the issue was added to the ACT database.

segment.source: For more information, see Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions.
segment.target: For more information, see Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions.

segment.source: Application Properties
segment.target: Application Properties

segment.source: Shows the following properties for the selected application:
segment.target: Shows the following properties for the selected application:

segment.source: MSI.
segment.target: MSI.

segment.source: Shows the installer name, vendor, version, language, and so on.
segment.target: Shows the installer name, vendor, version, language, and so on.

segment.source: Add/Remove Programs.
segment.target: Add/Remove Programs.

segment.source: Shows the application name that appears in Control Panel, vendor, registry path, and string for uninstalling.
segment.target: Shows the application name that appears in Control Panel, vendor, registry path, and string for uninstalling.

segment.source: Shell.
segment.target: Shell.

segment.source: Shows the shortcuts for the application and where the shortcuts appear on the Start menu.
segment.target: Shows the shortcuts for the application and where the shortcuts appear on the Start menu.

segment.source: Registry.
segment.target: Registry.

segment.source: Shows the registry name for the application, registry path, file name, and so on.
segment.target: Shows the registry name for the application, registry path, file name, and so on.

segment.source: Service Control Manager.
segment.target: Service Control Manager.

segment.source: Shows the entries in the Services console that correspond to the application.
segment.target: Shows the entries in the Services console that correspond to the application.

segment.source: Computers
segment.target: Computers

segment.source: Shows the following information for each of the computers that have the specified application installed:
segment.target: Shows the following information for each of the computers that have the specified application installed:

segment.source: Computer name, domain, and operating system.
segment.target: Computer name, domain, and operating system.

segment.source: Media Access Control (MAC) address for the computer.
segment.target: Media Access Control (MAC) address for the computer.

segment.source: Manufacturer of the computer.
segment.target: Manufacturer of the computer.

segment.source: Labels
segment.target: Labels

segment.source: Shows the label for the selected application.
segment.target: Shows the label for the selected application.

segment.source: For information about labels, see Labeling Data in ACM.
segment.target: For information about labels, see Labeling Data in ACM.

segment.source: Feedback
segment.target: Feedback

segment.source: Shows feedback that your testers have submitted to the ACT database for the selected application.
segment.target: Shows feedback that your testers have submitted to the ACT database for the selected application.

segment.source: Using the Application Dialog Box
segment.target: Using the Application Dialog Box

segment.source: In the Application dialog box, you can perform the following actions:
segment.target: In the Application dialog box, you can perform the following actions:

segment.source: Select your compatibility rating for the application.
segment.target: Select your compatibility rating for the application.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.

segment.source: Select your deployment status for the application.
segment.target: Select your deployment status for the application.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting Your Deployment Status.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting Your Deployment Status.

segment.source: Assign categories and subcategories to the application.
segment.target: Assign categories and subcategories to the application.

segment.source: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Specify the importance of the application to your organization.
segment.target: Specify the importance of the application to your organization.

segment.source: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Choose whether to synchronize data for the application with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Choose whether to synchronize data for the application with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application.

segment.source: Add, edit, or resolve an issue for the selected application, and add or edit solutions.
segment.target: Add, edit, or resolve an issue for the selected application, and add or edit solutions.

segment.source: For more information, see Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions.
segment.target: For more information, see Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions.
